fields.value: Survey of Fishing, Hunting, and Wildlife-Associated Recreation, 1980

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value: This three-part survey was conducted in 1980 by the Census  Bureau for the Department of the Interior to examine the fishing,  hunting, and wildlife-associated activities of United States  civilians. Part 1, File FH3, contains information on the kinds of  hunting and fishing done. Variables include the state, wildlife  region, or foreign country in which the activities occurred, the  number of trips taken, duration of trips, distance traveled from home,  the average catch or yield, and number of hours per day hunted or  fished. Additional information pertains to expenditures for hunting-  and fishing-related activities and membership in national or local  conservation or wildlife-related organizations. Part 2, File FH4,  includes data on wildlife observation, photography, and feeding. Data  furnished include type of site visited, type of area (local, state, or  federal), kinds of wildlife observed, and expenses for food, lodging,  transportation, and fees. Additional information is available on kinds  of wildlife present, types and amounts of feed provided, and equipment  costs. Part 3, File FH2, supplies information on respondents who  participated in fishing, hunting, or nonconsumptive  wildlife-associated activities (i.e., wildlife observation, photography, and feeding).

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.F. Social Institutions and Behavior, Leisure and Recreation

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB8201.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Although noninterview records in Part 3, the FH2 file,  contain weights in positions 25-36, the weights have not been adjusted and should not be used in any analysis.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

seriesName.value: National Survey of Fishing, Hunting, and Wildlife-Associated Recreation (FHWAR) Series

value: All persons in the civilian noninstitutional population of the United States living in households.

fields.value: The probability sample selected to represent the universe consists of approximately 143,000 households.
Checked for undocumented or out-of-range codes.
